div1.head: Jim to Mon. Paul Rockwell July 1st ‘15
div1.p: I guess you thought me an awful slob for not writing, but then it wasn’t my fault so much as the staff car’s. I kept waiting for it. Never again!

I received your letter with the clipping. Holy Smoke, where did you dope out the mixture? Railroad tracks & farm houses aren’t a very close resemblance but then what’s the “diff”. It will be amusing to get comments from the States if any one I know runs across the stuff. Be sure and get me a copy of the bunk with photo. That ought to be great. You know - ^ Sunday edition a border with bursting shells and a black sun setting over a heap of dead at the four corners. Its all very funny
the way papers frame it up isn’t it? By the way please be careful about using names. We are not supposed to give our location you know. At the front in Lorraine would do.

The 1er E. certainly is running in hard luck these days. After its glorious work at Carency you’d thing they’ed [sic] let em [sic] live to enjoy the fruits of their work. Doesn’t seem to be run that way tho [sic]. As soon as a regiment makes a name they keep using it until there’s nothing left.

Glad to hear Kiffin is to be in Paris soon. I am afraid there isn’t any chance of my getting down tho [sic].
Six new cars, detached from the tent section are to be sent to take up our back work to morrow. They will not be allowed any further than our old base. It means that we will have to work along the lines all the time with no chance for a refreshing long evacuation trip thru [sic] the country now and then as before. I’m laying for the first trip down to fill them full of bull.

My article on this section made a hit with the inspector and I may land something out of it. Hope so anyway, for finally, after writing me a number of letters telling me to return to America, my family had informed me that they will discontinue sending me even the small sums that I used to receive with much glee from time to time. Fortunately the amounts were small so I shall not miss them so much. I’ll drop you another note soon old socks.
